title: Heine and Nurse on African languages - outcome

content.question: Which of the following statements best represents one important outcome related to the argument in the excerpt?

choices.label: People in Northern Africa primarily speak Arabic because of the cultural connection to Islam.
Bantu linguistic family contains hundreds of languages that are spoken throughout West, Central, and Southern Africa today.
Because of an increase of trade with Europe, many Africans moved to Iberian port cities like Lisbon and Seville.
Due to the impacts of colonization and migration, today most African countries have unified their language.

content.answer: Bantu linguistic family contains hundreds of languages that are spoken throughout West, Central, and Southern Africa today.
